title: Familial development of lumbar spondylolysis: a familial case report of 7- and 4-year-old brothers and their father
patient: The boys’ 37-year-old mother was asymptomatic. However, she was worried about spondylolysis and visited our clinic. She underwent clinical and radiological examinations, and all investigations were negative for lumbar spondylolysis and spina bifida.
